pageContent: LOGINLOGOUTHELPPrinter FriendlyPageEarthfiles, news category.Share:DiggFacebookStumbleUpon 2005 Horse Mutilation in France © 2005 by Linda Moulton Howe October 3, 2005 Fessey, Haute-Saone, France - This past weekend I received atranslation of a French television news report about a July 8, 2005, unusual mutilation of ahorse in Fessey, Haute-Saone, France. The following is the August 7, 2005, France3-TVtext with images, as provided:"French ufologists, up to now, were not accustomed too much to thebusinesses of animal mutilations which, essentially before, occurred on theAmerican ground. Perhaps, but that is likely to change. Indeed, the France3chain has just made a report on the mysterious death of a foal in a village ofHaute-Saône, "Fessey".Ear and neck tissue removed without blood, along with genitals, discovered on July 8, 2005,and reported on August 7, 2005 by France3-TV. Image © 2005 by France3-TV."The owner and her husband initially thought that their foal had been the preyof a dog but, taking into account the characteristics of the wounds (clear,without burs, apparent absence of even coagulated blood), the gendarmesdismissed this assumption. The more so as, in accordance with the Americanmutilations, the sex of the foal "was also torn off to him" to take again theterms of the éleveuse one.Bloodless excision of tissue from the horse's neck. Image © 2005 by France3-TV."Another characteristic which will not fail to interest the ufologists, the ownerhad found the other horses of the grazing ground all thrown into a panic and

gathered around the foal. It added: "It was the first time that I saw that!".Horse's owner showing France3-TV the location of the mutilated horse.Image © 2005 by France3-TV."A veterinary surgeon was consulted and, as if that were not enough intrigant,declared that the foal had already died before the bites, most probably of thecontinuations of a stress and a cardiac attack! An autopsy will be carried out.Remain to see whether all will be communicated to us."Klaus Westphal, D.V.M., Veterinarian, performed a necropsy.Results yet to be reported.
